get.description:
Get pricing for the specified app. 

Live pricing is visible to all users. Pending pricing is only visible if you are authenticated as a vendor contact.

parameters.name: addonKey
parameters.description: The unique identifier for this app, for example "com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions"

parameters.name: liveOrPending
parameters.description: Specifies either the pricing that is currently in effect and visible to users (live), or pending that will take effect after a delay

404.description: The app is unknown or it does not have pricing of the specified type

put.description:
Update pricing for the specified app.

Updated pricing is always initially in the "pending" state.

For an app pending approval, pricing changes will go "live" when the app is approved. For an already-approved app, pricing changes will go "live" after 24 hours.

This resource requires authentication.

parameters.description: The unique identifier for this app, for example "com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions"

Use this resource to upload an app artifact (`.jar` or `.obr`) to Marketplace, so it can be used by an app version.

The request body is the file data.

If successful, the resource will respond with a resource link in `_links.self` that can be used as the `artifact` link when creating an app or app version. The response may include additional properties; other than `fileInfo`, these are used internally and should be ignored.

This resource requires authentication.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The logical filename

post.description:
Use this resource to copy and validate an app artifact (`.jar` or `.obr`) that is available from an external URL, so it can be used by an app version.

If successful, you will get a resource link in `_links.self` that can be used as the `artifact` link when creating an app or app version.

Note that this step can be skipped by just setting the `artifact` link to the external URL where the artifact is hosted when creating an app version; Marketplace will then download the artifact automatically.

This resource requires authentication.

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: Marketplace will attempt to download the artifact from this location

post.description:
Use this resource to upload an image (`.jpg`, `.png`, `.gif`, `.bmp`) to Marketplace, so you can use it for an app or vendor.

The request body is the file data.

If successful, you will get a resource link in _links.self that you can use as the appropriate image link in another resource, for example the `logo` link if you are creating an app.

Note that if the image is available from an external URL, you can skip this step by just setting the image link tothat external URL when you are creating the resource that uses it.

parameters.name: imageType
parameters.description: Specifies what this image will be used for, which determines the allowable image size

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The logical filename

get.description:
Returns details about a previously uploaded file that Marketplace is now storing.

The asset can either be an image file or an app artifact. If it is an app artifact, the response may include additional properties which are used internally and should be ignored.

parameters.name: assetName
parameters.description: The unique identifying string that Marketplace uses to refer to this asset

delete.description:
Removes a file from Marketplace storage which had been previously uploaded.

This is only allowed if:

1. you, rather than another user, uploaded the file, and
2. the asset is not currently being used by any other resource (for example, it cannot be the logo image for an existing app).

This resource requires authentication.

parameters.name: assetName
parameters.description: The unique identifying string that Marketplace uses to refer to this asset

externalDocs.description: Introduction to the API, basic concepts, and tutorials

documents.title: About
documents.body:
The Marketplace API is a RESTful API that allows you to manage apps and your vendor account.

Unsure about the types exposed in this API? [Read more](/platform/marketplace/glossary/) about our terminology.

documents.title: Versioning
documents.body: Version 2 is the latest release of the Marketplace API. Scroll down to view the latest API documentation for this version.

documents.title: Authentication
documents.body: The Marketplace API uses [HTTP basic authentication](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication). The username is your Atlassian Account email and the password is a generated [API token](https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens). Once authenticated, you can view and modify most properties of your apps and your account. If you are not logged in, you are considered an unauthenticated user and will not be able to edit apps or vendor information.

documents.title: URI structure
documents.body:
All [Uniform Resource Identifiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource_Identifier) (URIs) start with the following prefix:

``` bash
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/rest/2
```

When a resource provides a link to another resource, the link URI will not include the hostname (for instance, the link will be `/rest/2/addons` rather than `https://marketplace.atlassian.com/rest/2/addons`).

URIs referring to content that is not provided by Atlassian Marketplace are always absolute (that is, they use *http://* or *https://*) and are encoded as ordinary string properties.

documents.title: Request format
documents.body:
All request and response representations are in JSON and use the content type `application/json` with the UTF-8 character set, except for `PATCH` requests.

The Marketplace API uses standard HTTP methods. Successful `POST`, `PUT`, and `PATCH` requests return a `Location` header in addition to the HTTP status codes documented below. Successful `DELETE` requests return only the status code. See the [*Errors* section](/platform/marketplace/rest/#errors) for information about responses that return an error.

|Method  |Description                                                                                        |Successful response|
|--------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------|
|`GET`   |All `GET` requests are idempotent.                                                                 |200                |
|`POST`  |Creates a new entity.                                                                              |201                |
|`PUT`   |Modifies all editable properties of existing entity. It cannot be applied to a collection resource.|204                |
|`PATCH` |Modifies only selected properties of an existing entity. It cannot be applied to a collection resource. Request bodies use the [JSON Patch](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902) document structure with the content type `application/json-patch+json`.|204|
|`DELETE`|Removes an entity. It cannot be applied to a collection resource and accepts no request body.      |204                |

documents.title: Pagination
Response format
documents.body:
All resources containing links to Atlassian Marketplace resources and web pages use the [HAL specification](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Application_Language) with JSON (with some extensions as described below under `POST` and `PUT`, for cases that HAL does not cover). Such links will always be within a top-level `_links` or `_embedded` object. External links provided by third parties are considered simple data properties and can appear anywhere in a representation.

All resource links should:

- be relative to the host root, for example, `/rest/2/addons.`
- have a `self` link referring to themselves.

Links to the Marketplace website may be absolute or relative URIs. External links must always be absolute URIs.

When available, paginated responses provide the `next` and `prev` links to retrieve the next or previous page of items:

- `next` Retrieves the next page of items.
- `prev` Retrieves the previous page of items.

documents.title: Dates
documents.body: All dates referenced by the API are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

documents.title: Errors
documents.body:
The following response status codes may be accompanied by an error representation.

| Status | Description                                                          |
|--------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 400    | Request body is malformed or has an illegal property value.          |
| 401    | Authentication is required.                                          |
| 403    | User was authenticated but is not authorized for this operation.     |
| 404    | Resource does not exist or is not visible to this user.              |
| 409    | Resource cannot be created or modified due to some state constraint. |
| 500    | Unexpected internal error in the Atlassian Marketplace.              |
| 502    | Unexpected error in an external service.                             |

Error responses may contain a JSON representation with a single top-level property, `errors`, that contains an array of objects (each with a message) and optional `path` and `code` properties. The `path` uses [JSON Pointer](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901) format to refer to an invalid field in the request representation. If `path` is not present, the message describes a general condition that isn't tied to a specific field. If present, the `code` is a string that uniquely identifies the type of error. An example appears below:

``` javascript
{
    "errors": [
        { "message": "There is a general problem." },
        { "path": "/name", "message": "cannot be longer than 5000 characters" }
    ]
}
```

state.description: State of the contact, if available

postcode.description: Post code of the contact, if available

name.description: Name to describe the series

description.description: Long description of this tier, such as "App Name 10 Users: Commercial License"

editionId.description: Unique identifier for this tier, used internally

editionDescription.description: Short description of this tier, such as "10 Users"

editionType.description: Identifies the type of pricing, such as "user-tier"

amount.description: The amount (in USD) that a customer pays for a license at this tier

renewalAmount.description: The amount (in USD) that a customer with an existing license at this tier pays for a renewal; calculated by Marketplace, cannot be set

unitCount.description: The user count (or other unit if appropriate, such as remote agents in Bamboo) defining this pricing tier; -1 for unlimited

monthsValid.description: The time period that this pricing is for: 1 for monthly, 12 for annual

licenseType.description: The license type that this pricing is for: "commercial", "academic", etc.

token.description: The unique identifier for this access token

instance.description: Indicates with which remote host, if any, the token is associated

saleDate.description: The date on which the transaction occurred

licenseType.description: The unique identifier for this license type, for example "COMMERCIAL"

hosting.description: The platform on which the app runs (either 'Server' or 'Cloud')

billingPeriod.description: The number of months for which the transaction is valid

vendorAmount.description: The portion of the sale price which will be paid to the vendor

partnerDiscountAmount.description: For partner sales, the amount discounted before the sale price

loyaltyDiscountAmount.description: For partner sales, the amount discounted as Loyalty Discount

saleType.description: The display name of the sale type, for example "Renewal"

maintenanceStartDate.description: The date on which license maintenance begins

maintenanceEndDate.description: The date on which license maintenance ends

TransactionPurchaseDetails.description: The purchase details for a transaction

name.description: The display name of the user, for example "John Smith"

binary.description: Link for downloading app file(s), if the app is not directly installable

documentation.description: Link to external documentation for the app

license.description: Link to an external licensing information page for the app

learnMore.description: Link to "learn more" content for the app

eula.description: Link to an End User License Agreement page for the app

purchase.description: Link to a page for purchasing the app, if it is not paid via Atlassian

releaseNotes.description: Link to a release notes page for the app version

licenseId.description: The customer-facing identifier for this license, for example "SEN-12345"

maintenanceStartDate.description: The date on which license maintenance begins

maintenanceEndDate.description: The date on which license maintenance ends

monthsValid.description: The number of months that this license is valid for

name.description: Name to describe the series
The display name of the current series

elements.description: Time-specific elements for a given series

releaseNotes.description: Link to a release notes page for the app version

javadocs.description: Link to Java API documentation for the app version

source.description: Link to a source control repository for the app version

evaluationLicense.description: Link to a page for acquiring evaluation licenses for the app

donate.description: Link to a page for making donations to the vendor

name.description: Name to describe the series

descriptor.description: Link to download an app descriptor with this access token

href.description: The link URI - hostname and scheme will be omitted if it is a link within Marketplace

type.description: Content type of the linked data - may be omitted for JSON resources, will be "text/html" for web pages

title.description: Display name of the link - usually omitted

applications.description: Links to all the Atlassian applications the app is compatible with

categories.description: Resource links for any categories that the app belongs to, such as Integrations; for each app, vendors can specify up to four categories

pricing.description: Links to the app's pricing resource and pricing details page

reviews.description: Links to the app's reviews collection resource and review details page

name.description: The brief name of the category

functional.description: Always false as functional categories no longer exist; only logical categories

name.description: Name of the vendor

verifiedStatus.description: Indicates whether the vendor has Atlassian Verified status

isAtlassian.description: Whether this vendor is one of the Atlassian vendors

addonName.description: The display name of the addon

vendorId.description: The unique identifier for this vendor

addonKey.description: The unique identifier for this addon

cloudAddonKey.description: Cloud specific addonKey, for when an equivalent Cloud version of an existing Server/Data center app is hosted in its own separate Marketplace listing

cloudVersionDevelopmentRoadmap.description: URL to Page Documenting - Cloud version development roadmap

featureDifferenceDocumentation.description: URL to Page Documenting - Feature difference documentation

migrationDocumentation.description: URL to Page Documenting - Server/DC to cloud migration documentation

cloudMigrationAssistantCompatibility.description: A compatible version of addon's server version w.r.t. cloud migration assistant

cloudAddonKey.description: Cloud specific addonKey, for when an equivalent Cloud version of an existing Server/Data center app is hosted in its own separate Marketplace listing

cloudVersionDevelopmentRoadmap.description: URL to page documenting cloud version development roadmap

featureDifferenceDocumentation.description: URL to page documenting feature difference documentation

migrationDocumentation.description: URL to page documenting Server/DC to cloud migration documentation

cloudMigrationAssistantCompatibility.description: A compatible version of app's Server/DC version w.r.t. cloud migration assistant

path.description: References a location within the target document where the operation is performed

value.description: New value to save, will be ignored for 'remove' op. For '/cloudVersionAvailability' valid values are 'NATIVE', 'PUBLIC', and 'PRIVATE'
